images.copyright: Northern lights over a stranded boat in Tasiilaq, Greenland (© Shane P. White/Minden Pictures)
images.title: Northern lights aglow
images.caption: Tasiilaq, Greenland
images.desc: It's said that Erik the Red gave Greenland its deceptively pleasant name to draw unwitting settlers to the snowy subcontinent. The Viking leader wasn't totally fibbing, though: Greenland can turn pretty darn green when the aurora borealis gives the glaciers a glow-up.

tooltips.walle: This image is not available to download as wallpaper.
tooltips.walls: Download this image. Use of this image is restricted to wallpaper only.
